title: Collaborations with Elsevier and IPB Press
text:
This collaboration began with a simple idea ‚Äî to help students in food science and technology understand statistics better. When I was a lecturer, I often saw how students struggled with statistics. I wanted to make it easier and more relevant to their future work in the food industry.
Between 2017 and 2020, I discovered the book Statistics for Food Scientists: Making Sense of the Numbers by Frank Rossi and Viktor Mirtchev, published by Academic Press (Elsevier). I felt it was exactly the kind of book that could bridge the gap between theory and practice. Years later, I reached out to Elsevier to request permission to translate and adapt it into Bahasa Indonesia.
After several months of communication, Elsevier kindly granted permission for translation and adaptation. To publish it locally, I partnered with IPB Press, a reputable academic publisher in Indonesia. Together, we developed the Indonesian edition titled Statistika untuk Mahasiswa Sains dan Teknologi: Simulasi Magang di R&D Industri Pangan.
This adaptation is more than just a translation. It was designed to fit the Indonesian learning context ‚Äî combining academic rigor with practical insight from industry. I also invited professors, industry leaders, and education figures to contribute testimonials and reflections on the importance of statistical literacy for students.
In 2025, the book was officially published and is now available on the IPB Press website.
This project has been a meaningful journey for me ‚Äî combining my passion for science and technology education, statistical thinking and industrial practical skills. It reminded me why I started foodsaintika: to make scientific knowledge more accessible and inspiring for future food scientists.

title: Online Training - Collaboration with IPB Training
text:
In 2025, I had the opportunity to collaborate with IPB Training, who invited me ‚Äî as the translator of the book Statistika untuk Mahasiswa Sains dan Teknologi: Simulasi Magang di R&D Industri Pangan ‚Äî to lead a one-day workshop using the book as the main material.
The workshop, titled ‚ÄúSimulasi Menjadi Food Scientist: Praktik Analisis Data dan Desain Eksperimen di R&D Industri Pangan‚Äù, was held on Saturday, 2 August 2025.
It was designed as a hands-on session to help participants experience how data analysis and experimental design are applied in food industry R&D environments. The workshop emphasized statistical thinking, practical simulation, and problem-solving approaches ‚Äî bringing the concepts from the book into real-world practice.
The session was successfully conducted with 23 participants, including university students, researchers, lecturers, and industry professionals. Their enthusiasm and engagement showed how relevant and needed this kind of applied training is for bridging academic learning with industrial practice.
This collaboration marks another meaningful step for foodsaintika ‚Äî connecting education, research, and industry through accessible learning experiences in food science and technology.
